page.title: 04THE FARMER AND CONSERVATION
page.content: Mr Chatterton farms near Low Toynton and uses insecticides to protect his crops. He tries to use sprays that only kill aphids. Weed killers destroy the homes of many creatures so he tries to spray 4 feet away from all hedges to help conserve wildlife there. He plants about 8 trees every year and conserves copses, about \ an acre altogether on his land. Rivers and streams flow through his land, the biggest being the River Waring, which hold many creatures like trout, water vole and stickleback. Rare visitors are the heron, moorhen and kingfisher. He burns stubble which he says is essential for a clean field. It also gives back nutrients to the soil. The disadvantage of burning is that it destroys the homes of many creatures.
